Column Comment.0: ANALYSIS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample analysis. Various types ofanalysis may be conducted on a sample. Samples may be derived from lithologiccuttings, fluid collection etc.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: WATER ANALYSIS OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique observation number for thewater analysis.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: BARIUM: The quantity of barium in the water sample as determined by the wateranalysis.
Column Comment.6: BICARBONATE: The quantity of bicarbonate in the water sample as determined bythe water analysis.
Column Comment.8: BORON: The quantity of boron in the water sample as determined by the wateranalysis.
Column Comment.10: BROMINE: The quantity of bromine in the water sample as determined by the wateranalysis.
Column Comment.12: CALCIUM: The quantity of calcium in the water sample as determined by the wateranalysis.
Column Comment.14: CARBONATE: The quantity of carbonate in the water sample as determined by thewater analysis.
Column Comment.16: CHLORINE: The quantity of chlorine in the water sample as determined by the wateranalysis.
Column Comment.18: CONDUCTIVITY: The ability of the water to conduct electricity based on thepresence of charged ions. This value is directly related to the presence of chargedions.
Column Comment.20: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.21: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.22: HYDROGEN SULPHIDE: The quantity of hydrogen sulphide in the water sample asdetermined by the water analysis.
Column Comment.24: HYDROXIDE: The quantity of hydroxide in the water sample as determined by thewater analysis.
Column Comment.26: IODINE: The quantity of iodine in the water sample as determined by the wateranalysis.
Column Comment.30: IRON: The quantity of iron in the water sample as determined by the water analysis.
Column Comment.32: MAGENESIUM: The quantity of magnesium in the water sample as determined bythe water analysis.
Column Comment.34: ORGANICS DESCRIPTION: A narrative description of the organic material found inthe water sample.
Column Comment.35: PH OBSERVED: The observed pH of the water in the analysis. Should be around 7as water is neutral.
Column Comment.36: PH TEMPERATURE: The temperature at which the pH of the water sample wastaken.
Column Comment.38: POTASSIUM: The quantity of potassium in the water sample as determined by thewater analysis.
Column Comment.40: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.41: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether or not the water analysis ispreferred.
Column Comment.42: PROBLEM INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether or not there is a problem withthe step. If a yes flag is indicated, additional information regarding the problemshould be noted in the table ANL_PROBLEM.
Column Comment.43: RECOVERY DESCRIPTION: A narrative description of the recovery of the wateranalysis.
Column Comment.44: REFRACTIVE INDEX: The refractive index of the water sample. This is usuallyaround 1.333 pending on the conditions and the particular water sample.
Column Comment.45: REFRACTIVE INDEX TEMPERATURE: The temperature at which the refractiveindex of the water sample was taken.
Column Comment.47: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.48: RESERVOIR TEMPERATURE: Value for the temperature of the reservoir during themeasurement of the specific gravity (pycnometer).
Column Comment.49: RESERVOIR TEMPERATURE OUOM: Reservoir temperature original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.50: RESERVOIR WATER TEMPERATURE: Value for the reservoir water temperature,during the measurement of electrical resistivity.
Column Comment.51: RESERVOIR WATER TEMPERATURE OUOM: Reservoir water (RW) temperatureoriginal unit of measure.
Column Comment.52: SAMPLE WATER TYPE: The type of water sample that is analyzed, such as injectionwater, disposal water.
Column Comment.53: SODIUM: The quantity of sodium in the water sample as determined by the wateranalysis.
Column Comment.55: SODIUM POTASSIUM: The quantity of sodium potassium in the water sample asdetermined by the water analysis.
Column Comment.57: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.58: STEP SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number indicating the sequence of the stepamong other steps in the preparation and processing of the sample.
Column Comment.59: STRONTIUM: The quantity of strontium in the water sample as determined by thewater analysis.
Column Comment.61: SULPHATE: The quantity of sulphate in the water sample as determined by the wateranalysis.
Column Comment.63: WATER DENSITY: Value for the density or specific gravity of the water sample (therelationship of a given volume of sample to a given volume of distilled water).
Column Comment.64: WATER DENSITY OUOM: Water density original unit of measure.
Column Comment.65: WATER PH: Value for the pH level of the water sample (the amount of the negativelogarithm ion concentration, expressed on a scale of 0 to 14).
Column Comment.66: WATER RESISTIVITY: Value for the amount of electrical resistivity measured in thewater sample.
Column Comment.67: WATER RESISTIVITY OUOM: Reservoir water electrical resistivity original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.68: WATER TYPE: This reference table identifies the type of water being an alyzed. Forexample, fresh water, salt water or brackish water.
Column Comment.69: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.70: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.71: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.72: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.73: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.74: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.75: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
